arts.ttl: Daily Schmankerl: The aftermath of Bayern Munich vs. FC Augsburg; Joshua Kimmich probably won’t take pay cut; Has Real Madrid made its offer to Alphonso Davies?; Borussia Dortmund wanted Michael Olise before Bayern won the battle; and MORE!
arts.sum: Bayern Munich was trying to make things happen, but FC Augsburg was so compact that any combination, pass, or dribble had to be absolutely perfect to work. The future of Alphonso Davies has become a massive talking point of late as his contract at Bayern Munich is running out.

arts.ttl: Joshua Kimmich credits Bayern Munich’s composure in 3-0 win over FC Augsburg
arts.sum: Kimmich is correct, Bayern Munich was dominant. FC Augsburg offered nary a threat to really make the home side sweat, but it was not an easy win by any means.

arts.ttl: Vincent Kompany praises Bayern Munich’s patience in tough win over Augsburg
arts.sum: “It’s a Bundesliga game so it’s normal it won’t be easy,” said Kompany (via @iMiaSanMia ). Augsburg was fully committed to a five-man low block that frustrated Bayern for the first 60 minutes of the match, but Mads Pedersen’s unintentional handball in the box broke the deadlock.

arts.ttl: Harry Kane smashes Erling Haaland record with yet another Bayern Munich hat-trick
arts.sum: Harry Kane Bundesliga logo goal just dropped. Bayern teased and tested him throughout — but not always convincingly, and nothing came close to the sizzle he faced from Kane in these three moments of glory, two of which came as the game was drawing to a close (90+3’, 90+5’).

arts.ttl: Bavarian Podcast Works: Postgame Show — Bayern Munich 3-0 FC Augsburg (Bundesliga)
arts.sum: Be sure to stay tuned to Bavarian Podcast Works for all of your up to date coverage on Bayern Munich and Germany. In the end, Bayern Munich would win 3-0, but it was not easy.

arts.ttl: Four Observations from Bayern Munich’s deserved 3-0 win over FC Augsburg
arts.sum: Kim Min-jae and Dayot Upamecano put on yet another masterclass in defense this match, now making it six clean sheets on the bounce, and an entire calendar month since the team last conceded a goal. This is the best use of Goretzka’s ability to tear defensive lines apart once he receives at the edge of the box between the lines, as well as his ability to pick out passes into the box from deep as he often played long balls into the box when Bayern had just recovered the ball as a way to catch Augsburg in transition — one of these pinpoint balls resulting in Harry Kane’s hat-trick sealer.

arts.ttl: European football: Kane hits hat-trick for leaders Bayern as PSG cruise
arts.sum: England captain breaks Bundesliga record with 50th goal PSG win 3-0 ahead of Champions League trip to Munich The England captain Harry Kane scored a hat-trick, with two of the goals in second-half stoppage time, to give Bayern Munich a 3-0 victory over Augsburg on Friday. The win helped the hosts open up an eight-point gap at the top of the Bundesliga. Bayern, who take on Paris Saint-Germain in the Champions League next week, are undefeated in the league and have 29 points after their fifth consecutive league game without conceding. Second-placed RB Leipzig, who travel to Hoffenheim on Saturday, are on 21 points. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Harry Kane becomes the fastest player to score 50 goals in the Bundesliga
arts.sum: Kane scored 36 goals in 32 league appearances last season, his first for Bayern after joining from Tottenham. Harry Kane is the quickest player to score 50 goals in the Bundesliga after scoring a hat trick on his 43rd appearance on Friday.

arts.ttl: Match Awards from FC Bayern’s strong-ish 3-0 win over FC Augsburg
arts.sum: The Augsburg and Croatian goalkeeper was essential to FC Augsburg’s defense today, despite conceding an eventual three goals to Bayern Munich . Surprisingly, the out of favor German was the most in form midfielder for Bayern Munich today, and actually put in a really good performance.

arts.ttl: Harry Kane tops Erling Haaland, fastest to 50 Bundesliga goals
arts.sum: Bayern had possession and chances, but the visitors defended resolutely with Augsburg goalkeeper Nediljko Labrović denying Kane, then twice Jamal Musiala to keep the game scoreless at half-time. Harry Kane became the fastest player to reach 50 Bundesliga goals, eclipsing previous record-holder Erling Haaland, with a hat trick in Bayern Munich's 3-0 win over Augsburg on Friday.
